3.  Load in your data.

Load in your raw data file - with `load` command for the `addhealth4` data
```{r}
load("/cloud/project/data/addhealth4.RData")
```

Select variables
```{r}
mydata <- addhealth4 %>% 
  select(RACE, BIO_SEX4, iyear4, h4od1y , H4GH1, H4GH7, H4GH8, H4MH2, H4MH7, H4MH9, H4MH22, H4MH23, H4MH24, H4MH25, H4DA11, H4ED2, H4KK15B, H4RD14, H4RD14T, H4LM19)
```

Recode variables
```{r}
mydata_c <- mydata %>% 
  mutate(race_c = recode_factor(RACE,
                                "5"="white",
                                "2"="black",
                                "4"="asian_pacific_islander",
                                "3"="native_american",
                                "1"="multiple_races",
                                "6"="other",
                                .ordered=T)) %>% 
  mutate(vigorous_activity = recode_factor(H4DA11,
                                 "1"="yes",
                                 "0"="no",
                                "6"="refused",
                                "8"="don't know",
                                .ordered=T)) %>% 
  mutate(H4RD14C = recode(H4RD14T,
                          "1"=52,
                          "2"=12,
                          "3"=1
                          )) %>% 
  mutate(H4RD14C = na_if(H4RD14C,
                         "6")) %>% 
  mutate(H4RD14C = na_if(H4RD14C,
                         "8")) %>% 
  mutate(yearly_no_sex = round(H4RD14*H4RD14C,0)) %>% 
    mutate(gender = recode_factor(BIO_SEX4,
                                  "1" ="male",
                                  "2"="female",
                                  .ordered=T)) %>%  
  mutate(college_deg = recode_factor(H4ED2,
                             "1"="no",
                             "2"="no",
                             "3"="no",
                             "4"="no",
                             "5"="no",
                             "6"="no",
                             "7"="yes",
                             "8"="yes",
                             "9"="yes",
                             "10"="yes",
                             "11"="yes",
                             "12"="yes",
                             "13"="yes",
                             "98"="don't know",
                             .ordered=T)) %>% 
  mutate(too_tired = recode_factor(H4MH23, 
                                   "0"="never or rarely",
                                   "1"="sometimes",
                                   "2"="alot of the time",
                                   "3"="most of the time or all of the time",
                                   "6"="refused",
                                   .ordered=T)) %>% 
  mutate(age = iyear4-h4od1y) %>% 
  mutate(hrs_work_week = H4LM19 ) %>% 
  mutate(education = recode_factor(H4ED2,
                             "1"="not hs grad",
                             "2"="not hs grad",
                             "3"="hs grad",
                             "4"="post hs",
                             "5"="post hs",
                             "6"="post hs",
                             "7"="bachelors",
                             "8"="bachelors",
                             "9"="adv degree",
                             "10"="adv degree",
                             "11"="adv degree",
                             "12"="bachelors",
                             "13"="adv degree",
                             "98"="don't know",
                             .ordered=T))
                              
```
    


```{r}
glimpse(mydata_c)
```

```{r}
demo <- mydata_c %>% select(race_c, gender , age, college_deg, vigorous_activity, too_tired, hrs_work_week, education  )
```

```{r}
save(demo, file="/cloud/project/data/demo_addhealth_clean.Rdata")
```
